description: Haz-Map is an occupational health database designed for health and safety professionals and for consumers seeking information about the adverse effects of workplace exposures to chemical and biological agents. The main links in Haz-Map are between chemicals and occupational diseases. These links have been established using current scientific evidence. The information in Haz-Map comes from textbooks, journal articles, the Documentation of the Threshold Limit Values (published by ACGIH), and electronic databases such as NLM Hazardous Substances Data Bank (HSDBÂ®). Haz-Map staff classifies, summarizes, and regularly updates the information found in the database.
title: Haz-Map
